interface.name: org.freedesktop.Telepathy.Connection.Interface.Privacy

method.name: GetPrivacyMode

arg.tp:docstring: A string representing the current privacy mode

method.tp:docstring: Return the current privacy mode, which must be one of the values returned by GetPrivacyModes.

method.name: GetPrivacyModes

arg.tp:docstring: An array of valid privacy modes for this connection

method.tp:docstring:
Returns the privacy modes available on this connection. The following well-known names should be used where appropriate:
allow-allany contact may initiate communication allow-specifiedonly contacts on your 'allow' list may initiate communication allow-subscribedonly contacts on your subscription list may initiate communication

signal.name: PrivacyModeChanged
signal.tp:docstring: Emitted when the privacy mode is changed or the value has been initially received from the server.

method.name: SetPrivacyMode
method.tp:docstring: Request that the privacy mode be changed to the given value, which must be one of the values returned by GetPrivacyModes. Success is indicated by the method returning and the PrivacyModeChanged signal being emitted.

interface.tp:docstring: An interface to support getting and setting privacy modes to configure situations such as not being contactable by people who are not on your subscribe list. If this interface is not implemented, the default can be presumed to be allow-all (as defined in GetPrivacyModes).
